intro: Gaertnera macrostipula, commonly known as the large-stipitate gaertnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with leathery, elliptical leaves that have prominent stipules. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with pink or white petals, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Gaertnera macrostipula is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky habitats.
